definitions.definition: In a frank or candid manner, especially in a way that may seem too open , excessively honest , or slightly blunt .
examples: He spoke frankly about the economy.

definitions.definition: In truth , to tell the truth .
examples: Most of what they said was, frankly , a pack of lies.

definitions.definition: To a degree large enough as to be plainly evident .

main_definition: In a frank or candid manner, especially in a way that may seem too open , excessively honest , or slightly blunt .
secondary_definitions: ( sentence adverb ) In truth , to tell the truth .
( sciences , medicine ) To a degree large enough as to be plainly evident .
